Description: To make scalloped potatoes, start by thinly slicing potatoes and layering them in a buttered dish. Season heavy cream with garlic, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Pour cream mixture over the potatoes and bake until golden. A simple, tasty side dish perfect for special occasions.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 3 cloves garlic, 400 ml heavy cream, 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg, butter (for greasing), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/350Â°F. Peel potatoes and slice thinly with a mandoline or sharp knife. Peel and mince garlic. Grease a baking dish with butter. Arrange half of the potato slices in baking dish, overlapping slightly. Pour half of the cream mixture over potatoes, then add remaining potato slices. Pour remaining cream mixture over potatoes. Bake at 180Â°C/350Â°F for approx. 90 min., or until potatoes are tender and top is golden brown. Let cool slightly before serving. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 617, Fat 40 g, Protein 10 g, Carb 56 g
Tags: kid friendly, vegetarian, christmas, vegan alternative, side, main, gluten free, crowd pleaser, lactose free alternative, pescetarian, prepare ahead, comfort food, savory, dairy, vegetables, autumn, winter, oven

Recipe Name: Spanish roasted potatoes with salsa brava
Description: Crispy roasted potatoes served with a smoky, spicy salsa brava. A classic Spanish tapas dish perfect for sharing.
Ingredients: 1 kg waxy potatoes, 1 onion, 3 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp flour, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 2 tbsp tomato paste, 250 ml vegetable stock, 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 bay leaf, parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Wash potatoes, pat dry, and cut into bite-sized wedges. Transfer to a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and toss to coat. Distribute potatoes onto a parchment-lined baking sheet and roast for approx. 20 â€“ 30 min. at 200Â°C/400Â°F, or until crispy and golden brown. For the salsa brava: Peel and finely dice onion and garlic. Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sautÃ© until soft. Add flour and stir to combine. Add smoked paprika, cayenne pepper, tomato paste, and vegetable stock. Add bay leaf, season with salt and pepper, and simmer for approx. 10 â€“ 15 min., until thickened. Remove bay leaf. Serve roasted potatoes with salsa brava and garnish with parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 346, Fat 13 g, Protein 6 g, Carb 52 g
Tags: kid friendly, roasting, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, vegan, side, main, cheese alternative, gluten free, crowd pleaser, lactose free, spanish, tapas, pescetarian, spices, comfort food, European, savory, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, oven

Description: This hearty German potato soup is a comforting classic. Creamy potatoes with vegetables, perfect for cold days.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 2 carrots, 1 leek, 2 stalks celery, 100 g bacon, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1.2 L vegetable stock, 200 ml heavy cream, 2 bay leaves, 1 tsp marjoram, vegetable oil (for frying), parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and dice potatoes. Peel and dice carrots. Clean and slice leek. Dice celery. Dice bacon. Peel and dice onion and garlic. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Fry bacon until crispy, remove and set aside. In the same pot, sautÃ© onion and garlic until soft. Add carrots, celery, and leek, sautÃ© for a few minutes. Add potatoes, vegetable stock, bay leaves, and marjoram. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min., until vegetables are tender. Remove bay leaves. Use an immersion blender to partially blend the soup, leaving some chunks for texture. Stir in heavy cream, season with salt and pepper. Serve soup garnished with crispy bacon and parsley. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 447, Fat 22 g, Protein 11 g, Carb 51 g
Tags: kid friendly, weeknight dinner, main, gluten free, german, pork, comfort food, soup, savory, dairy, vegetables, autumn, winter

Description: Crispy smashed potatoes loaded with cheese, bacon, and all your favorite toppings. The perfect appetizer or side dish.
Ingredients: 1 kg small potatoes, 100 g bacon, 100 g cheddar cheese (shredded), 100 g sour cream, 2 scallions, 4 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook for approx. 15 â€“ 20 min., until fork-tender. Drain and let cool slightly. Preheat oven to 220Â°C/425Â°F. Place potatoes on a baking sheet, use a potato masher or fork to gently smash each potato. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Bake at 220Â°C/425Â°F for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min., until crispy and golden. Meanwhile, dice bacon and fry until crispy. Slice scallions. Remove potatoes from oven, top with shredded cheddar cheese. Return to oven for 2 â€“ 3 min. until cheese melts. Top with crispy bacon, sour cream, and scallions. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 477, Fat 28 g, Protein 14 g, Carb 44 g
Tags: kid friendly, weeknight dinner, side, main, american, gluten free, cheese, crowd pleaser, comfort food, savory, dairy, vegetables

Recipe Name: Classic steak au poivre (French pepper steak) with mashed potatoes and green bean bundles
Description: Classic French pepper steak with a rich cream sauce, served with creamy mashed potatoes and elegant green bean bundles.
Ingredients: 2 steaks (200g each), 800 g floury potatoes, 300 g green beans, 2 slices bacon, 2 tbsp black peppercorns, 2 tbsp brandy, 150 ml heavy cream, 100 ml beef stock, 50 g butter, 100 ml milk, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, salt
Instructions: For the mashed potatoes: Peel and quarter potatoes. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil, add potatoes, cook for approx. 20 min. until tender. Drain, return to pot, mash with butter and milk until smooth. Season with salt. For the green beans: Trim green beans. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil, blanch beans for 3 â€“ 4 min. Drain and rinse with cold water. Bundle beans together, wrap each bundle with a slice of bacon. For the steak: Crush peppercorns, press onto both sides of steaks. Season with salt. Heat oil in a pan over high heat. Sear steaks for 2 â€“ 3 min. on each side for medium-rare. Remove and let rest. Add brandy to pan (be careful of flames), scrape up browned bits. Add beef stock and heavy cream, simmer until thickened. Return steaks to pan briefly. Fry bacon-wrapped bean bundles in a pan until bacon is crispy. Serve steaks with mashed potatoes, green bean bundles, and pepper sauce. Enjoy!
Tags: weeknight dinner, main, french, beef, dinner party, comfort food, savory, alcohol, dairy, vegetables

Description: A popular Chinese dish featuring crispy fried eggplant, potatoes, and peppers in a savory sauce.
Ingredients: 2 eggplants, 2 potatoes, 2 bell peppers, 4 cloves garlic, 1 piece ginger, 3 scallions, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp dark soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 1 tbsp sugar, 1 tsp cornstarch, 100 ml water, vegetable oil (for frying), salt
Instructions: Cut eggplants and potatoes into chunks. Cut bell peppers into pieces. Mince garlic and ginger. Slice scallions. In a bowl, mix soy sauce, dark soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, cornstarch, and water. Heat oil in a wok or large pan over high heat. Fry potato chunks until golden and crispy, remove and set aside. Fry eggplant chunks until golden and tender, remove and set aside. Fry bell pepper pieces briefly, remove and set aside. In the same wok, sautÃ© garlic, ginger, and scallions until fragrant. Return all vegetables to the wok. Pour in the sauce, stir-fry until everything is well coated and the sauce thickens. Serve hot with rice. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 334, Fat 18 g, Protein 5 g, Carb 39 g
Tags: kid friendly, weeknight dinner, vegetarian, vegan, main, chinese, asian, comfort food, savory, vegetables, sauteing

Recipe Name: Potato soup with fried porcini mushrooms
Description: Creamy potato soup elevated with the earthy flavor of fried porcini mushrooms.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 200 g fresh porcini mushrooms, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 L vegetable stock, 200 ml heavy cream, 3 tbsp butter, 2 tbsp olive oil, parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and dice potatoes. Clean and slice porcini mushrooms. Peel and dice onion and garlic. Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat. SautÃ© onion and garlic until soft. Add potatoes and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min. until potatoes are tender. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Stir in heavy cream, season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Fry porcini mushroom slices until golden and crispy. Season with salt. Serve soup in bowls, top with fried porcini mushrooms and garnish with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: Creamy potato soup with a spicy kick from fresh horseradish.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 L vegetable stock, 200 ml heavy cream, 50 g fresh horseradish, 2 tbsp butter, chives (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and dice potatoes. Peel and dice onion and garlic. Peel and grate fresh horseradish. Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat. SautÃ© onion and garlic until soft. Add potatoes and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min. until potatoes are tender. Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Stir in heavy cream and grated horseradish. Season with salt and pepper. Serve soup in bowls, garnish with chives. Enjoy!

Description: A luxurious gratin with layers of tender potatoes and leeks in a creamy sauce, topped with melted cheese.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 2 leeks, 200 g GruyÃ¨re cheese, 100 g Parmesan cheese, 300 ml heavy cream, 200 ml vegetable stock, 2 cloves garlic, nutmeg, butter (for greasing), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/350Â°F. Peel and thinly slice potatoes. Clean and slice leeks. Grate GruyÃ¨re and Parmesan cheeses. Peel and mince garlic. Mix together cream, vegetable stock, grated Parmesan, garlic, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Grease a baking dish with butter. Layer half of the potato slices in the dish, top with half of the leeks. Pour half of the cream mixture over. Repeat with remaining potatoes, leeks, and cream mixture. Sprinkle grated GruyÃ¨re on top. Cover with aluminum foil, bake at 180Â°C/350Â°F for approx. 45 min. Remove foil, bake for another 15 min. until golden and bubbly. Let cool slightly before serving. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Keema curry (Spiced ground beef with potatoes)
Description: A flavorful Indian curry with spiced ground beef and tender potatoes.
Ingredients: 500 g ground beef, 3 potatoes, 1 onion, 4 cloves garlic, 1 piece ginger, 2 tomatoes, 2 tbsp curry powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp garam masala, 200 ml beef stock, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, cilantro (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and dice potatoes. Peel and dice onion, garlic, and ginger. Dice tomatoes. Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Brown ground beef, breaking it up with a spoon. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, sautÃ© onion, garlic, and ginger until soft. Add curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook until they break down. Return ground beef to the pan, add potatoes and beef stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min. until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice or naan, garnish with cilantro. Enjoy!

Description: A comforting German casserole with kohlrabi and potatoes in a creamy sauce.
Ingredients: 800 g potatoes, 2 kohlrabi, 1 onion, 200 g bacon, 300 ml heavy cream, 100 ml vegetable stock, 100 g cheese (shredded), 2 tbsp butter, nutmeg, parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/350Â°F. Peel and slice potatoes and kohlrabi. Peel and dice onion. Dice bacon. Heat butter in a pan, fry bacon until crispy. Add onion, sautÃ© until soft. In a bowl, mix heavy cream, vegetable stock, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Grease a baking dish. Layer half of the potatoes and kohlrabi, top with half of the bacon and onion mixture. Pour half of the cream mixture over. Repeat layers. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Cover with aluminum foil, bake at 180Â°C/350Â°F for approx. 35 min. Remove foil, bake for another 10 min. until golden. Garnish with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: Creamy mashed potatoes with a horseradish kick, served with savory meatballs.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 500 g ground beef, 1 egg, 50 g breadcrumbs, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 50 g fresh horseradish, 100 ml milk, 50 g butter, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: For mashed potatoes: Peel and quarter potatoes. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil, cook potatoes for approx. 20 min. until tender. Drain, mash with butter and milk. Peel and grate horseradish, stir into mashed potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. For meatballs: Peel and finely dice half of the onion and 1 clove garlic. Mix ground beef, egg, breadcrumbs, diced onion, diced garlic, salt, and pepper. Form into small meatballs. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry meatballs until browned and cooked through, approx. 10 â€“ 12 min. Serve horseradish mashed potatoes with meatballs, garnish with parsley. Enjoy!

Description: An easy, cheesy casserole featuring potato, cauliflower and bacon bits. Perfect comfort food.
Ingredients: 800 g potatoes, 1 cauliflower, 100 g bacon, 200 g cheese (shredded), 300 ml heavy cream, 2 cloves garlic, nutmeg, butter (for greasing), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/350Â°F. Peel and slice potatoes. Cut cauliflower into florets. Dice bacon. Peel and mince garlic. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Blanch cauliflower florets for 3 â€“ 4 min. Drain. Fry bacon until crispy. Grease a baking dish with butter. Layer half of the potato slices, top with half of the cauliflower and bacon. Season with salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Repeat layers. Pour heavy cream mixed with garlic over everything. Sprinkle shredded cheese on top. Cover with aluminum foil, bake at 180Â°C/350Â°F for approx. 35 min. Remove foil, bake for another 10 min. until golden. Enjoy!

Description: A quick and easy potato gratin made with three types of potatoes and cheese.
Ingredients: 400 g regular potatoes, 400 g sweet potatoes, 400 g purple potatoes, 200 g Emmentaler cheese (shredded), 300 ml heavy cream, 2 cloves garlic, nutmeg, butter (for greasing), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Peel and thinly slice all three types of potatoes. Grate Emmentaler cheese. Peel and mince garlic. Mix heavy cream with garlic, nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Grease a microwave-safe baking dish. Evenly layer half of the potatoes in the dish. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with three quarters of the shredded Emmentaler cheese. Add remaining potato slices. Pour cream mixture over. Microwave on high for approx. 10 min. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Transfer to oven, bake at 200Â°C/400Â°F for approx. 10 min. until cheese is golden and bubbly. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Fish fingers with mashed potatoes and remoulade
Description: Crispy homemade fish fingers served with creamy mashed potatoes and tangy remoulade sauce.
Ingredients: 500 g white fish fillets, 1 kg floury potatoes, 100 g flour, 2 eggs, 150 g breadcrumbs, 100 ml milk, 50 g butter, 200 g mayonnaise, 2 tbsp capers, 2 tbsp pickles, 1 tbsp mustard, 1 tbsp lemon juice, vegetable oil (for frying), salt, pepper
Instructions: For mashed potatoes: Peel and quarter potatoes. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil, cook potatoes for approx. 20 min. until tender. Drain, mash with butter and milk. Season with salt. For remoulade: Finely chop capers and pickles. Mix mayonnaise, capers, pickles, mustard, and lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. For fish fingers: Cut fish fillets into finger-sized pieces. Prepare three bowls: one with flour, one with beaten eggs, one with breadcrumbs. Season fish with salt and pepper. Coat each piece in flour, then egg, then breadcrumbs. Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Fry fish fingers until golden and crispy, approx. 3 â€“ 4 min. per side. Serve fish fingers with mashed potatoes and remoulade. Enjoy!
Tags: kid friendly, weeknight dinner, main, german, fish, comfort food, savory, frying, dairy

Description: A comprehensive guide to cooking potatoes using various methods: boiling, roasting, mashing, and frying.
Ingredients: 1 kg potatoes, salt, butter (optional), oil (optional)
Instructions: For boiling: Wash potatoes. Place in a pot, cover with cold water, add salt. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer for 15 â€“ 20 min. until tender. Drain. For roasting: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Cut potatoes into chunks. Toss with oil, salt, and pepper. Roast for 30 â€“ 40 min. until golden. For mashing: Boil potatoes as above. Drain and mash with butter and milk. Season with salt. For frying: Cut potatoes into slices or wedges. Heat oil in a pan. Fry until golden and crispy. Season with salt. Each method brings out different textures and flavors!

Recipe Name: Tartiflette (French potato, bacon, and cheese casserole)
Description: A delicious warming classic from the French Alps that had us at the main ingredients cheese, bacon, and potatoes.
Ingredients: 1 kg waxy potatoes, 200 g bacon (lardons), 2 onions, 1 Reblochon cheese, 200 ml heavy cream, 100 ml dry white wine, 2 cloves garlic, butter (for greasing), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Wash potatoes, place in a pot of salted boiling water. Cook for approx. 20 min. until tender. Drain, let cool, then slice. Peel and slice onions. Peel and mince garlic. Fry bacon in a pan until crispy. Remove and set aside. In the same pan, sautÃ© onions and garlic until soft. Grease a baking dish with butter. Layer half of the potato slices, top with half of the bacon and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Repeat layers. Mix heavy cream and white wine, pour over potatoes. Cut Reblochon cheese in half horizontally, place on top cut-side down. Bake at 200Â°C/400Â°F for approx. 30 min. until cheese is melted and golden. Serve hot. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: 5-ingredient sour cream and onion smashed potatoes
Description: A foolproof recipe for the crispiest, fluffiest, baked potatoes with an easy sour cream and onion dip. And, only 5 ingredients!
Ingredients: 1 kg small potatoes, 200 g sour cream, 1 packet onion soup mix, 4 tbsp olive oil, chives (for garnish), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 220Â°C/425Â°F. Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes, cook for approx. 15 â€“ 20 min. until fork-tender. Drain and let cool slightly. Place potatoes on a baking sheet. Use a potato masher to gently smash each potato. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper. Bake at 220Â°C/425Â°F for approx. 25 â€“ 30 min. until crispy and golden. For the dip: Mix sour cream with onion soup mix. Garnish potatoes with chives. Serve with sour cream and onion dip. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Spanish potato omelette / Tortilla de patatas
Description: A classic Spanish dish featuring potatoes and eggs cooked into a thick, hearty omelette.
Ingredients: 1 kg potatoes, 6 eggs, 1 onion, 200 ml olive oil, salt
Instructions: Peel and thinly slice potatoes and onion. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add potatoes and onion, cook slowly for approx. 20 â€“ 25 min. until tender but not browned. Drain potatoes and onion, reserving the oil. Beat eggs in a large bowl, season with salt. Add cooked potatoes and onion to eggs, mix gently. Heat 2 tbsp of the reserved oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Pour in the egg and potato mixture, spread evenly. Cook for approx. 5 â€“ 7 min. until the bottom is set. Place a large plate over the pan, flip the omelette onto the plate. Slide it back into the pan to cook the other side for another 5 â€“ 7 min. Slide onto a serving plate, let cool slightly. Cut into wedges and serve. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Potato skillet with chorizo and feta
Description: A flavorful one-pan dish with crispy potatoes, spicy chorizo, and creamy feta cheese.
Ingredients: 800 g potatoes, 200 g chorizo, 150 g feta cheese, 1 red bell pepper, 1 onion, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 2 tbsp olive oil, parsley (for garnish), salt, pepper

Recipe Name: Baked potatoes with corn and beans

Description: Tender, translucent potatoes with a creamy interior and crispy exterior, cooked slowly in butter and stock.
Ingredients: 2 kg potatoes, 100 g butter, 400 ml chicken stock, 2 sprigs rosemary, 4 cloves garlic, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 220Â°C/450Â°F top bottom heat (200Â°C/400Â°F convection). Put whole, skin-on potatoes into a large pot and cover with cold water. Recipe Name: Duck Confit, Lyonnaise Potatoes and Duck Fat Carrots
Description: An elegant French dish featuring duck confit with potatoes and carrots cooked in duck fat.

Instructions: Salt duck legs and refrigerate overnight. Cover with duck fat and slow cook at 150Â°C for 3 hours. For Lyonnaise potatoes: Slice potatoes and onions. Fry in duck fat until golden. Description: Ultra creamy mashed potatoes loaded with roasted garlic flavor.
Ingredients: 1 kg floury potatoes, 1 head garlic, 150 ml heavy cream, 100 ml milk, 100 g butter, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Cut top off garlic head, drizzle with oil, wrap in foil. Roast for 30 â€“ 40 min. until soft. Peel and quarter potatoes. Boil in salted water for approx. 20 min. until tender. Drain and mash. Squeeze roasted garlic cloves out of their skins. Heat cream, milk, and butter until warm. Add to mashed potatoes along with roasted garlic. Mash until smooth and creamy. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot. Enjoy!

Description: A fresh spring dish with new potatoes, wild garlic, and greens.
Ingredients: New potatoes, wild garlic, spring greens, butter, lemon, salt, pepper
Instructions: Boil new potatoes until tender. Blanch spring greens. SautÃ© wild garlic in butter. Toss potatoes and greens with wild garlic butter. Season with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Enjoy!

Description: Classic fried potatoes, crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.
Ingredients: 1 kg potatoes, 1 onion, 4 tbsp vegetable oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Peel and slice potatoes. Peel and slice onion. Heat oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add potato slices, fry for approx. 15 â€“ 20 min., turning occasionally, until golden and crispy. Add onion slices, cook for another 5 min. until onions are soft and caramelized. Description: Sweet and savory Korean-style braised potatoes in a delicious soy-based sauce.
Ingredients: 800 g potatoes, 3 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sugar, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 2 cloves garlic, 1 tbsp sesame seeds, 2 scallions, 200 ml water, vegetable oil
Instructions: Peel and cut potatoes into chunks. Mince garlic. Slice scallions. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add potato chunks, fry for 5 min. until slightly golden. Add soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat. Cover and simmer for approx. 15 â€“ 20 min. until potatoes are tender and sauce has thickened. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and scallions. Serve hot. Enjoy!

Description: Tender pork or lamb chops served with light and fluffy mashed potatoes.
Ingredients: 4 pork or lamb chops, 6 large russet potato, 4 sprigs thyme, 2 sprigs rosemary, 2 cloves garlic, 1 sprig mint, 1 stalk celery, Â¾ tsp cornflour, 6 tbsp unsalted butter, â…“ cup cream, Â½ cup beef stock, salt and pepper
Instructions: Peel and chop potatoes. Rinse to remove starch. Boil in salted water. Season chops with salt, pepper, and rosemary. Fry chops in butter with herbs for 3-7 min per side. Remove meat. Make gravy with cornflour and beef stock. Extract celery juice and chop mint for lamb. Add warm cream and butter to potatoes and mash. Serve chops with mashed potatoes, gravy, and steamed peas. Enjoy!

Description: Classic creamy mashed potatoes, a perfect side dish for any meal.
Ingredients: 3 lbs mixed potatoes (russet and yukon gold), 1 stick butter, 2 tbsp butter (for garnish), Â½ cup milk, Â½ cup sour cream, black pepper, salt
Instructions: In a large pot, cover potatoes with water and add salt. Bring to a boil and cook until soft, 16 to 18 minutes. Drain and return potatoes to pot. Mash until smooth. Melt butter and milk until warm. Pour over potatoes and stir until combined. Add sour cream and stir. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl and top with remaining butter. Season with more pepper. Enjoy!

Description: With this kitchen hack using baking soda, you will get the crispiest roast potatoes every time!
Ingredients: 2 kg floury potatoes, 4 g baking soda, 5 tbsp olive oil, 3 cloves garlic, Â½ lemon, 1 sprig rosemary, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 220Â°C/450Â°F. Peel and cut potatoes into chunks. Bring 2L water to a boil with salt and baking soda. Add potatoes, boil, then simmer for approx. 10 min. Finely chop garlic and rosemary. Heat olive oil with rosemary, garlic, and pepper. Strain oil into a bowl. Drain potatoes, return to pot to evaporate moisture. Toss potatoes in the oil until mushy surface forms. Spread on baking sheet. Roast for 20 min., turn, continue roasting for 40 min. until deep brown and crispy. Grate lemon zest and add to garlic-rosemary mixture. Toss potatoes with mixture. Serve immediately. Enjoy!
Nutrition: Cal 363, Fat 11 g, Protein 7 g, Carb 60 g
Tags: kid friendly, roasting, vegetarian, christmas, vegan, side, crowd pleaser, comfort food, Meatless, european, savory, vegetables, spring, autumn, summer, winter, oven

Description: Simple and flavorful roasted potatoes with fresh rosemary and garlic.
Ingredients: 1 kg potato, 3 cloves garlic, 10 g rosemary, 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/400Â°F. Peel and halve potatoes, add to a baking dish. Crush garlic and add along with rosemary. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil, and toss well. Bake in preheated oven at 200Â°C/400Â°F for approx. 25 min. or until golden brown. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Roasted endive and potatoes with gribiche
Description: Roasted endive and potatoes served with a tangy gribiche sauce made with hard-boiled eggs, herbs, and pickles.
Ingredients: 5 endives, 12 new potatoes, 5 eggs, 5 cornichons, 1 tbsp capers in brine, 1 tbsp parsley, 1 tbsp tarragon, 150 ml mayonnaise, Â½ tbsp grainy mustard, 1 tsp sherry vinegar, olive oil, salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/390Â°F. Trim endive, slice in quarters. Quarter potatoes. Transfer to baking sheet, drizzle with oil, season with salt. Arrange endive cut-side up and potatoes cut-side down. Roast at 200Â°C/390Â°F for approx. 25 min., turning halfway. Boil eggs for 9 min. until hard boiled. Peel eggs, finely chop with cornichons, capers, parsley, and tarragon. Add mayonnaise, mustard, and sherry vinegar. Mix well, season with salt and pepper. Serve roasted endive and potatoes with gribiche. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Mushroom Gratin Lasagna and Roasted Hasselback Potatoes
Description: A hearty meal combining mushroom lasagna gratin with crispy roasted hasselback potatoes.
Ingredients: 900 g brown mushrooms, 85 ml butter, 125 ml dry white wine, 5Â¾ tbsp flour, 160 ml sour cream, Â¼ tsp ground nutmeg, 1 tbsp basil, 200 g cheddar cheese, 1 tbsp Fresh parsley, 6 sheets Lasagna, 1 kg Baby potatoes, 50/50 mix of olive oil and sunflower oil, 2 tbsp rosemary, 450 ml milk, salt and pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/160Â°C Fan/Gas 4. Slice baby potatoes using wooden spoons as guides. Heat oil in roasting tray for 10 min. Add potatoes, season with salt, pepper, rosemary, and basil. Cook for 1hr 20min, turning every 15-20 min. Slice mushrooms. Melt 60ml butter, sautÃ© mushrooms until tender. Mix sour cream, 2 tbsp flour, salt, pepper, nutmeg. Stir into mushrooms, simmer 6 min. Add 60g cheese and wine, stir until melted. Melt remaining butter with flour. Gradually stir in milk until sauce thickens. Add 100g cheese. Add mushroom mix to oven dish. Layer lasagna, add cheese sauce, sprinkle remaining cheese and parsley. Bake 30 min. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Honeyed roast potatoes and fennel with goat cheese
Description: Roasted potatoes and fennel with honey and goat cheese - a Greek-inspired dish.
Ingredients: 150 g potatoes, 1 fennel, 2 radishes, Â¼ tsp sugar, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tbsp beer, 100 g goat cheese (roll), 1 tbsp honey, chives for serving (optional), extra olive oil for frying, salt
Instructions: Preheat oven to 150Â°C/300Â°F. Remove fennel core and green section. Cut lengthwise into strips. Peel and quarter potatoes. Quarter radishes, toss with sugar. Place potatoes on baking sheet, toss with oil and beer. Season with salt. Bake at 150Â°C/300Â°F for approx. 20 min. Heat oil in frying pan. Add fennel, season with salt, sautÃ© for 5 min. 3 min before potatoes are done, add radishes to tray. Bake briefly. Remove tray, turn oven off. Place potatoes and fennel on plate. Slice goat cheese, place on top. Transfer to oven for 2 min. to soften cheese. Pour honey over top, add radishes. Garnish with chives. Enjoy!

Description: Simple potato recipe with curry for a tasty side dish.
Ingredients: 500 g potatoes, 25 g curry powder, 10 g soy sauce, 10 g green chilis
Instructions: Boil potatoes in water for 15 mins, half cooked and drain. Chop boiled potatoes into small pieces, mix well with curry power and soy sauce; add green chilli pieces for heat. Pour mixed potatoes into oven dish and bake for 15mins at 200Â°C. Enjoy!

Description: A homemade potato gratin with mozzarella, cream cheese, and bacon.
Ingredients: 3 potatoes, 100 g mozzarella cheese, 200 ml heavy cream, 2 slices smoked bacon (cubed), 80 g cream cheese, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp ground nutmeg

Description: Creamy, cheesy potatoes with ground beef. A comforting family favorite!

Grease baking dish. Layer Â½ potatoes, all ground beef, â…“ cheese. Add remaining potatoes, then remaining cheese. Cover with foil. Bake at 210Â°C/410Â°F for 30 min. Remove foil, bake for another 15 min. until golden brown. Let rest for 5-10 min. Chop parsley and sprinkle over. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Chicken breast with spinach and quick potato gratin
Description: Tender chicken breast with smoked bacon and a quick potato gratin, served with sautÃ©ed spinach.

Instructions: Preheat oven to 180Â°C/360Â°F. Wash and slice potatoes. Boil in salted water for 5 min. Dice onions. SautÃ© in oil with crushed stock cube, salt, and pepper until golden. Description: A holiday tradition featuring mashed potatoes with mozzarella, prosciutto, and garlic, baked to perfection.
Ingredients: 5 lb bag Yukon gold potatoes, 1 lb mozzarella cheese, 1/3 lb prosciutto, 5-6 cloves fresh garlic, olive oil, Spanish paprika, salt & pepper
Instructions: Mash potatoes as you normally would. Dice mozzarella and prosciutto. Melt butter and add minced garlic. Add ingredients to mashed potatoes. Butter baking dish. Put potato mixture in. Lightly brush olive oil on top and sprinkle with grated cheese and Spanish paprika. Refrigerate overnight or put in 350 degree oven till lightly browned. Enjoy!

Recipe Name: Creamy savoy cabbage, ground beef, and potato gratin
Description: Creamy ground beef, potato and in-season savoy cabbage gratin, perfect for autumn.
Ingredients: 800 g waxy potatoes, 400 g savoy cabbages, 400 g ground beef, 1 onion, 1 clove garlic, 2 tbsp unsalted butter, 2 tbsp flour, 400 ml milk, Â¼ tsp ground nutmeg, 1 tbsp mustard, vegetable oil (for frying), chives (for serving), salt, pepper
Instructions: Preheat oven to 200Â°C/395Â°F. Add potatoes to pot with cold water and salt. Boil, reduce heat, cook for 20 min. Drain and let cool. Bring another pot of salted water to boil. Cut savoy cabbage into squares. Blanch for 3 min., rinse with cold water. Peel and slice cooked potatoes. Peel and mince onion and garlic. For bÃ©chamel: Melt butter, sautÃ© half onion and garlic for 3 min. Add flour. Whisk in milk gradually. Season with nutmeg, mustard, salt, pepper. Set aside. Heat oil in frying pan. SautÃ© remaining onion and garlic for 1 min. Add ground beef. Fry for 5 min. until brown. Season with salt and pepper. Grease baking dish. Layer Â½ potatoes, ground meat, savoy cabbage. Cover with remaining potatoes, pour bÃ©chamel over. Bake at 200Â°C/395Â°F for 20 min. until golden. Garnish with chives. Enjoy!

Description: A crispy hash brown as pizza base topped with light crÃ¨me fraÃ®che, smoked bacon and chives.

Description: Sweet potatoes stuffed with corned beef, kale, and cheese.
Ingredients: 1 x 12 oz can Hereford Corned Beef (diced), 4 Sweet Potatoes (cooked), 1 tbsp butter, Â½ cup kale (chopped), Â½ cup green onion (diced), 1 cup shredded cheese (Gruyere or mild cheddar)
Instructions: Heat oven to 400Â°F. Cut cooked sweet potatoes open lengthwise, about 1/3 from top. Scoop out inside, reserve. Cook butter and kale in skillet until wilted. Place in oven for 15 minutes until cheese melts. Let cool slightly. Enjoy!
